info.description: Access state of the art crypto payment rails easily using TransFi's API
info.title: TransFi Single Integrated API

get.description: Retrieves a list of all fiat currencies available for payin and payout, including supported local currencies that comply with the [ISO 4217 standard](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217#) (e.g., USD). This list specifies the currencies that merchants can display on a payment page for end users but does not include the currencies that can be stored in wallets on the platform.

parameters.description: Payment Direction i.e. - deposit or withdraw
parameters.name: direction

parameters.description: Current Page Number
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Limit records
parameters.name: limit
MID
parameters.description: Merchant or sub-merchant MID. Used to execute the request in the context of that specific entity.

400.description: Request containing missing or invalid parameters.

get.description: To retrieve a list of banks and local wallets currently supported, we can enable additional methods based on your preferences. Please contact our team to request the activation of more methods.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: Currency of the payment
Limit of records per page
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Display page number
parameters.name: page
direction
parameters.description: Direction of the payment i.e - deposit or withdraw
Display additional details required for headless mode
parameters.name: headlessMode
MID
parameters.description: Merchant or sub-merchant MID. Used to execute the request in the context of that specific entity.

parameters.name: userType
parameters.description: Display userType payment methods

Missing arguments.summary: Request containing missing or invalid parameters.

400.description: Request containing missing or invalid parameters.

get.description: Retrieves the current live rates for deposits and withdrawals for the same currency, offering real-time exchange rate information.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: Fiat Currency Symbol

parameters.name: MID
parameters.description: Merchant or sub-merchant MID. Used to execute the request in the context of that specific entity.

Invalid parameters.summary: Request containing missing or invalid parameters.

400.description: Request containing missing or invalid parameters.

get.description: This API allows you to retrieve a quote for converting a specified fiat amount into a corresponding cryptocurrency amount. It requires key parameters such as the fiat currency (fiatTicker), the amount to convert (amount), the target cryptocurrency (cryptoTicker), and the payment method (paymentCode). The response provides the conversion details based on real-time rates. The cURL example demonstrates how to use the API with required headers and query parameters.

parameters.name: fiatTicker
parameters.description: Fiat Currency Symbol

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: Fiat Amount

parameters.name: cryptoTicker
parameters.description: Crypto Currency Symbol

parameters.name: paymentCode
parameters.description: Payment Method Symbol

parameters.name: MID
parameters.description: Merchant or sub-merchant MID. Used to execute the request in the context of that specific entity.

Invalid arguments.summary: Request containing missing or invalid parameters

400.description: Request containing missing or invalid parameters.

get.description: This API provides real-time conversion quotes for selling cryptocurrency in exchange for fiat currency. Users can specify the crypto currency (cryptoTicker), the amount to convert (amount), the fiat currency (fiatTicker). The response contains conversion details, enabling businesses to calculate precise payout amounts. The cURL example illustrates the required headers and query parameters for API usage.

parameters.name: cryptoTicker
parameters.description: Crypto Currency Symbol

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: Crypto amount if direction is forward; Fiat amount if direction is reverse

parameters.name: fiatTicker
parameters.description: Fiat Currency Symbol

parameters.name: paymentCode
parameters.description: Payment Method Symbol

parameters.name: MID
parameters.description: Merchant or sub-merchant MID. Used to execute the request in the context of that specific entity.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: Direction of the Exchange Rates Flow - Allowed Enums - `forward` or `reverse`

Invalid arguments.summary: Request containing missing or invalid parameters

400.description: Request containing missing or invalid parameters

get.description: This API allows you to retrieve a quotes for Fiat Payin with Wallet Flow. It requires key parameters such as the fiat currency (depositCurrency), the amount to convert (amount), and the payment method (paymentCode). The response provides the conversion details based on real-time rates. The cURL example demonstrates how to use the API with required headers and query parameters.

parameters.name: depositCurrency
parameters.description: Fiat Currency Symbol

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: Fiat Amount

parameters.name: paymentCode
parameters.description: Payment Method Symbol

parameters.name: MID
parameters.description: Merchant or sub-merchant MID. Used to execute the request in the context of that specific entity.

Invalid arguments.summary: Request containing missing or invalid parameters

400.description: Request containing missing or invalid parameters.

get.description: Retrieves the current quotes for paying in fiat currencies and converting to stablecoins. This provides the exchange rate and the equivalent stablecoin amount for a given fiat deposit, allowing users to understand the conversion rate and associated fees when exchanging fiat for stablecoins.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: Amount you will be depositing

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: Currency you will be depositing

parameters.name: paymentCode
parameters.description: Payment Code for which you want to check fees for
Direction of the Exchange Rate Flow
parameters.name: direction
balanceCurrency
parameters.description: Specifies the fiat/stable currency for which you want to fetch the exchange rates. This is the currency you intend to settle in. If no value is specified, it will your default settlement currency(USDC, EUR)

parameters.name: MID
parameters.description: Merchant or sub-merchant MID. Used to execute the request in the context of that specific entity.

quoteId.description: Quote Id - Can be passed as a parameter while creating orders to ensure same quotes **within one minute**

Invalid Arguments.summary: Request containing missing or invalid parameters

400.description: Request containing missing or invalid parameters.

get.description: Retrieves the current quotes for payouts from stablecoins to fiat currencies. This provides the exchange rate and the equivalent fiat amount for a given stablecoin withdrawal, allowing users to understand the conversion rate and associated fees when exchanging stablecoins for fiat.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: Amount you will be withdrawing

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: Currency you will be withdrawing

parameters.name: paymentCode
parameters.description: Payment Code for which you want to check fees for
Direction of the Exchange Rate Flow
parameters.name: direction
balanceCurrency
parameters.description: Specifies the fiat/stable currency for which you want to fetch the exchange rates. This is the currency you intend to use the balance for. If no value is specified, it will your default balance currency(USDC, EUR)

parameters.name: MID
parameters.description: Merchant or sub-merchant MID. Used to execute the request in the context of that specific entity.

quoteId.description: Quote Id - Can be passed as a parameter while creating orders to ensure same quotes **within one minute**

Invalid arguments.summary: Request containing missing or invalid parameters

400.description: Request containing missing or invalid parameters.

post.description: This API allows the creation of an individual user profile within the system. The user can be registered as a sender or recipient, depending on the requirements of your integration. The required fields include personal details such as name, email, country, and address, along with additional fields based on compliance requirements.

requestBody.description: Payload passed in - Contacts POST Request

Invalid Arguments.summary: Request containing missing or invalid parameters

400.description: Request containing missing or invalid parameters.

parameters.name: MID
parameters.description: Merchant or sub-merchant MID. Used to execute the request in the context of that specific entity.

get.description: This API allows you to retrieve a list of individual users registered in the system. Use the GET method to query the endpoint with appropriate headers. The response will include details about individual users, enabling you to review or manage their profiles based on your integration requirements.

400.description: Request containing invalid or missing parameters.

parameters.name: MID
parameters.description: Merchant or sub-merchant MID. Used to execute the request in the context of that specific entity.

post.description: This API facilitates the creation of a business user profile in the system. A business user can be registered as either a sender or a recipient, depending on your integration needs. Required fields include business details such as name, registration number, email, country, and address, along with additional fields to meet compliance requirements.

regNo.description: Unique number assigned to the company when it was registered as a legal entity.

date.description: Date of company incorporation (format dd-mm-YYYY, e.g. 25-09-2001).

requestBody.description: Payload passed in - Contacts POST Request

400.description: Request containing missing or invalid parameters.

parameters.name: MID
parameters.description: Merchant or sub-merchant MID. Used to execute the request in the context of that specific entity.

get.description: This API retrieves a list of registered business users from the system. Using the GET method, it allows you to query business user details for management or review purposes. The provided cURL request demonstrates how to make the API call, including necessary headers.

parameters.name: MID
parameters.description: Merchant or sub-merchant MID. Used to execute the request in the context of that specific entity.

post.description: Our KYC API simplifies user verification, boosting conversion rates while adhering to global AML and KYC standards. We collect necessary documents using a risk-based approach to ensure compliance. With our KYC endpoints, you can verify users during sign-up or later. Once verified, users can make or receive payments seamlessly. KYC is mandatory for fund senders. Using our API, you can directly KYC your users through our partnership with Sumsub. The endpoint provides a URL for users to complete their KYC verification efficiently.

email.description: Email of the user. **Note:** Use an email with domain **@kycfailure.sandbox** to simulate kyc_failure.

redirectUrl.description: where the redirection should happen after submitting KYC

Missing arguments.summary: Request containing missing or invalid parameters

400.description: Request containing missing or invalid parameters

Unexpected error.summary: Unexpected error. User may try and send the request again

500.description: Unexpected error. User may try and send the request again.

parameters.name: MID
parameters.description: Merchant or sub-merchant MID. Used to execute the request in the context of that specific entity.

post.description: Our Advanced KYC API extends the verification process beyond standard KYC, enabling users to access higher transaction limits and enhanced features while maintaining strict compliance with global AML and KYC standards

400.description: Request containing missing or invalid parameters.

500.description: Unexpected error. User may try and send the request again.

parameters.name: MID
parameters.description: Merchant or sub-merchant MID. Used to execute the request in the context of that specific entity.

post.description: Our KYC API simplifies the user verification process, boosting your conversion rate. We adhere to the highest global standards for AML and KYC, collecting necessary documents from your users using a risk-based approach. With our KYC endpoints, you can verify customers during sign-up or at their convenience. Once verified, they can make or receive payments without extra steps during checkout. It is mandatory for the sender of funds to be KYCed with the relevant documents. TransFi and its clients can enter into a tripartite agreement with Sumsub to enable direct KYC sharing based on a common token. This endpoint facilitates seamless integration for sharing KYC data.

400.description: Request containing missing or invalid parameters.

404.description: Request containing missing or invalid parameters.

value.message: User email or phone does not match with share token email or phone.
Required KYC information is missing in the share token response.

422.description: Unprocessable Entity - Request data validation failed.

500.description: Unexpected error. User may try and send the request again.

parameters.name: MID
parameters.description: Merchant or sub-merchant MID. Used to execute the request in the context of that specific entity.

post.description: Our KYC API simplifies the user verification process, increasing your conversion rate. We adhere to the highest global standards for AML and KYC and gather necessary documents from our customer's users using a risk-based approach. Using our KYC endpoints, you can verify customers during sign-up or at their convenience. Once verified, they can make or receive payments without any extra steps during checkout. It is mandatory for the sender of funds to be KYCed with relevant documents. If you do not use Sumsub as your KYC provider, fret not! You can pass the required KYC information directly to us and we will take care of the rest.

country.description: User's current country in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 (ISO2) country code

dob.description: User's date of birth in yyyy-mm-dd

email.description: Email of the user .**Note:** Use an email with domain **@kycfailure.sandbox** to simulate kyc_failure.

idDocBackSide.description: The back side of the ID document (e.g., ID_CARD Back).

idDocFrontSide.description: The front side of the ID document (e.g., ID_CARD Front)

idDocIssuerCountry.description: Country of document issue in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 (ISO2) country code.

idDocType.description: The type of the ID document (e.g., passport ,id_card ,drivers)

nationality.description: User's nationality in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 (ISO2) country code

phoneNo.description: User's phone number with +countryCode as prefix.

404.description: Request containing missing or invalid parameters.

500.description: Unexpected error. User may try and send the request again.

parameters.name: MID
parameters.description: Merchant or sub-merchant MID. Used to execute the request in the context of that specific entity.

post.description: For higher transactional volumes, once certain thresholds for payments have been reached, it is necessary to collect additional documents and information from the sender of funds. These requests can be fulfilled by sharing the required data directly using this endpoint. Additionally, for specific countries, supplementary documentsbeyond the standard requirementscan also be shared using this endpoint.

400.description: Request containing missing or invalid parameters.

500.description: Unexpected error. User may try and send the request again.

parameters.name: MID
parameters.description: Merchant or sub-merchant MID. Used to execute the request in the context of that specific entity.

invoiceId.description: The `invoiceId` generated against the uploaded PDF

400.description: Bad Request

Example 1.message: Invalid enum value. Expected 'invoice' | 'receipt' | 'contract' | 'other', received 'invoic' - invoiceType

value.message: Invalid enum value. Expected 'invoice' | 'receipt' | 'contract' | 'other', received 'invoic' - invoiceType
Exactly one PDF (field name: invoice) is required.
Invalid enum value. Expected 'payout' | 'payin', received 'payi' - transactionType

post.description:
This API endpoint allows you to upload a PDF document (e.g. an invoice or bill). In response, it returns a unique invoiceId that serves as a reference to the uploaded document.

You can then include this invoiceId in the root level of the payload when creating a Payin or Payout order to associate the uploaded invoice with that transaction.

email.description: Email with which the invoice will be associated

invoiceType.description: Type of invoices accepted, Accepted Enum Values - `invoice`, `receipt`, `contract`, `commercial_document`

invoice.description: File to be uploaded, PDF Only

direction.description: Direction of the Fund Flow, `deposit` OR `withdraw`

parameters.name: MID
parameters.description: Merchant or sub-merchant MID. Used to execute the request in the context of that specific entity.

link.description: User can be redirected to this link where we will collect necessary information required for initiating Standard KYB for the Business User

expiresIn.description: The Link Expiry time after which the link will not be accessable

400.description: Basic KYB not Approved

Example 1.message: Basic KYB verification must be approved before proceeding to Standard level

value.message: Basic KYB verification must be approved before proceeding to Standard level
KYB Standard level verification link generation failed
Standard KYB has already been approved

post.description: We collect necessary documents using a risk-based approach to ensure compliance. With our KYB endpoints, you can verify users during sign-up or later. Once verified, users can make or receive payments seamlessly. KYB is mandatory for fund senders. Using our API, you can directly KYB your users. The endpoint provides a URL for users to complete their KYB verification efficiently.

email.description: Email for which the Standard KYB needs to be initiated

parameters.name: MID

link.description: User can be redirected to this link where we will collect necessary information required for initiating Advanced KYB for the Business User

post.description: We collect necessary documents using a risk-based approach to ensure compliance. With our Advanced KYB endpoint, you can verify users who have completed Standard KYB verification. Once verified, users can make or receive payments seamlessly. Advanced KYB is mandatory for higher transaction limits. Using our API, you can directly initiate Advanced KYB for your users. The endpoint provides a URL for users to complete their Advanced KYB verification efficiently.

email.description: Email for which the advanced KYB needs to be initiated

post.description: Payments in fiat currencies can be accepted from end users. These payments can be settled either in a batch or instantly, depending on the preconfigured settings.

deviceDetails.userAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_15_7; rv:118.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/118.0
Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_15_7; rv:118.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/118.0

balanceCurrency.description: Balance Currency - Specifies the fiat/stable currency for which you want to update balance in. If no value is specified, it will take the currency of the collection order.

sourceUrl.description: Merchant website URL from where the traffic is flowing to TransFi.

additionalDetails.description: Required for the headless integration, and all fields to be submitted based on the response from [v2/paymentMethods](https://docs.transfi.com/reference/list-payment-methods) API.

deviceDetails.description: Details of the user's device. Required in `headlessMode`

paymentCode.description:
Name of the Payment Method
**Example: bpi**

quoteId.description:
Quote Id
> ###### Optional Field

Can be passed as a parameter while creating orders to ensure same quotes **within one minute**
After one minute the quoteId will expire and will have to be re-issued if passed in order payload.

Note: Onramp does not support Quote Caching functionality

`Hit the exchange rates api for new quoteId`

withdrawDetails.description: User's bank details or crypto wallet address for the settlement. The settlement type is `Batch` by default. Please contact TransFi team to enable `Instant` settlement.

additionalDetails.description: The field will be Dynamic with respect to country, currency and paymentCode passed. All fields to be submitted based on the response from [v2/paymentMethods](https://docs.transfi.com/reference/list-payment-methods) API (direction **withdraw**). (Only required for fiat settlement)

cryptoTicker.description:
Crypto Ticker of the above specified wallet address.
                        Please find available `cryptoTicker` list from [here](https://docs.transfi.com/reference/list-tokens). The `id` field in the response corresponds to the `cryptoTicker` value. (Only required for crypto settlement)

currency.description: The currency that user wants to get instant settlement. (Only required for fiat settlement)

paymentCode.description:
Name of the Payment Method
**Example: bpi** (Only required for fiat settlement)

walletAddress.description: Wallet Address of the specified cryptoTicker on which user want the onramp. (Only required for crypto settlement)

invoiceId.description:
Invoice ID created via Upload Invoice API
> Relevant Only to Fiat Payin

requestBody.description: Payload passed in - Collections POST Request

post.description: Payouts in fiat currencies can be created for end users. These can be processed by prefunding TransFi in advance or using the payin balance (unsettled), depending on the preconfigured settings.

deviceDetails.userAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_15_7; rv:118.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/118.0
Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_15_7; rv:118.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/118.0

balanceCurrency.description:
Specifies the fiat/stable currency from which you want the balance to be deducted. If `balanceCurrency` is not provided:  
- If `quoteId` is passed, the system uses your default balance currency (USDC, EUR)  
- If `quoteId` is not passed, it defaults to the local withdrawal currency

depositDetails.description: Require to execute the payout agains the crypto deposit at transaction level.

cryptoTicker.description: The cryptoTicker you want to make deposit with. This can be found from on `List Tokens` API in `Configuration`

sendersWalletAddress.description: The wallet address by which the deposit is being made `Mandatory for offramp`

additionalDetails.description:
The field will be `Dynamic` with respect to `country`, `currency` and `paymentCode` passed.
                    Details of what field needs to be passed will be provided from the `List Payment Methods` API in `Configuration`

paymentCode.description:
Name of the Payment Method
**Example: dana**

quoteId.description:
Quote Id
> ###### Optional Field

Can be passed as a parameter while creating orders to ensure same quotes **within one minute**
After one minute the quoteId will expire and will have to be re-issued if passed in order payload.

Note: Offramp does not support Quote Caching functionality

`Hit the exchange rates api for new quoteId`

sourceUrl.description: Merchant website URL from where the traffic is flowing to TransFi.

invoiceId.description:
Invoice ID created via Upload Invoice API
> Relevant Only to Fiat Payout

requestBody.description: Payload passed in - Payouts POST Request

Prefunds in any currency can be accepted from organizations. These prefunds can be used for payouts.

Name of the Payment Method
**Example: sepa_bank**
